page.description: The A5_HTML_EDITOR() function displays the HTML Editor and returns the title of the window that was created.
page.syntax: C a5_html_editor([C tabname [,C html_code [,C default_ext [,L use_toolbars ]]]])

argument.name: tabname
argument.description: Optional. Defines which of two tabs will appear. Defaults to "WYSIWYG". Possible values are:

item.name: Other values = The WYSIWYG tab gets the initial focus.

argument.name: html_code
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". Initial text to put into the editor.

section.title: Example
section.description: This example initializes the editor with plain text.
section.example: a5_html_editor("WYSIWYG", "Initial text to appear in the editor.")

section.description: This example initializes the editor with html text, although the results appear in the WYSIWYG tab.
section.example:
dim cc as C cc = "A5_HTML_EDITOR()" cc = cc + " A5_HTML_EDITOR() Syntax "
cc = cc + "A5_HTML_EDITOR( Tabname as C, " cc = cc + "HTML_Text as C ) "
a5_html_editor("WYSIWYG", cc)
